main

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Keeps track of properties of the board being driven on.
    Author:
    Scott Sewell

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(int lrzx,
     int lrzy,
     int urzx,
     int urzy,
     int lgzx,
     int lgzy,
     int ugzx,
     int ugzy,
     StartParameters startParams)
        Constructor for the board.
        Parameters:
        lrzx - the red zone lower corner x position.
        lrzy - the red zone lower corner y position.
        urzx - the red zone upper corner x position.
        urzy - the red zone upper corner y position.
        lgzx - the green zone lower corner x position.
        lgzy - the green zone lower corner y position.
        ugzx - the green zone upper corner x position.
        ugzy - the green zone upper corner y position.
        startParams - the StartParameters instance.

        Gets the position of the line intersection nearest to the starting corner.

      • inBounds

        public boolean inBounds(Vector2 position)
        Checks if the robot would fit on the board while at a specified position.
        Parameters:
        position - the position to check the validity of.
        Returns:
        true if the robot should fit at the position.

        Checks if the robot could overlap the enemy zone while at a specified position.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the robot could overlap at the position.

      • inTeamZone

        public boolean inTeamZone(Vector2 position)
        Checks if the a point is within the team zone.
        Parameters:
        position - the position to check.
        Returns:
        true if the point is within the zone.

      • crossesEnemyZone

        public boolean crossesEnemyZone(Vector2 lineStart,
                       Vector2 lineEnd)
        Checks if the robot would overlap the enemy zone while traveling between two points.
        Parameters:
        lineStart - the start of the travel path.
        lineEnd - the end of the travel path.
        Returns:
        true if the robot could overlap while traveling.

      • getNearestIntersection

        public static Vector2 getNearestIntersection(Vector2 position)
        Calculates the x-axis and y-axis line intersection on the board that is closest to a given coordinate.
        Returns:
        a Vector2 with the position of the intersection in cm.

      • findPath

        public java.util.List<Vector2> findPath(Vector2 from,
                               Vector2 to,
                               java.util.List<Vector2> obstacles)
        Gets the shortest path between two board points that avoids any invalid regions.
        Parameters:
        from - the position traveled from.
        to - the position traveled to.
        obstacles - a list of the center of any obstacles that should be navigated around.
        Returns:
        a new list of waypoints the robot should travel between.

      • getNearestNavPoint

        public Vertex getNearestNavPoint(Vector2 position,

        Get the nearest point on the board that is in the navigation graph.
        Returns:
        the closest Vertex.
